Under FASB (ASC) 815-15-25, an embedded derivative, such as a conversion option, must be separated from its host contract (in this case, the bonds) and accounted for as a derivative instrument if certain criteria are met. This case study illustrates how to apply the guidance on accounting for embedded derivatives contained in FASB ASC 815, , including determining the fair value of the embedded derivative and host contract. The case study also provides an example of how to apply the guidance contained in AU-C section 501B, , to an embedded derivative. Accounting Standards Codification Derivatives and Hedging Audit Evidence — Specific Considerations for Selected Items
All AU-C sections can be found in AICPA . Each AU-C section in this guide designated with a “B” suffix (for example, “AU-C section 200B”) denotes content that does not reflect the codification of Statements on Auditing Standards (SASs) Nos. 134–140 or the amendments to other SASs made by SAS Nos. 134–140 and subsequently-issued SASs.
